item.title: Dumped bag of rubbish, 30th November
item.description:

item.title: Bollards knocked down, yellow plastic barriers taking up pavement and dangerous for pedestrians, 30th November
item.description:
3 bollards knocked down October 10 and still there surrounded by yellow plastic bollards that are constantly being knocked over onto pavement and curb making the pavement impassable. It is very dangerous crossing the road from Kelsey Park at the island crossing as the area of yellow bollards is so big, you have to walk in the road to get to the other side safely. This has been previously reported (October 30) and is still not fixed. Lots of elderly people and children/babies use this island crossing frequently and it is so dangerous being left as it is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Road, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Happen Guo has fly tipped his pallets and boxes outside a nursery, 30th November
item.description:
A resident from somewhere else has fly tipped their box pallets and massive boxes shipped from Chinese companies outside a nursery and youth centre these will not be collected by bin men and as such will pose a hazard to the community. You will see in the third picture he’s left his name and address on one. I believe the nursery and or the community centre may have external cctv footage if you act quickly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valeswood Road, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tip is across the road from 8 south street. It’s an overflowing bin from a commercial property, 30th November
item.description:
The tip is across the road from 8 south street. It’s an overflowing bin from a commercial property. This bin has not been collected in my many weeks and has been left out in the street with an increase of bin bags added causing the overflow to the pavement. This tip will likely cause infestation in the area along with taking space from the pavement. It’s also an eyesore for residents across the road considering this bin has been in this state for roughly 3 weeks. These bins should only be allowed onto the pavement during collections and should not be permanent fixture in front of my property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, South Street, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tape stuck in a tree, 30th November
item.description:
It’s been two years now and nobody can remove it, reporting it again

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jamaica Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin, 30th November
item.description:
Reported 3 times now. 87 Kingsground have left their overflowing recycling bin on the public pavement. It is full with non recycle-able waste, and the lid is broken off so little is blowing all over the street and onto private gardens. Someone needs to come and remove the bin. The BIN MEN WILL NOT TAKE IT. And the resident of 87 Kingsground WILL NOT FIX IT. They have just abandoned it on the public footpath. All this money 'invested' in flytipping and 2 reports later and still nothing is done.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsground, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge amount of flytipping, 30th November
item.description:
Mattresses/bed black bags plus various others and sprawled across road. Corner of Brookdene and Bannockburn, which is a regular site for flytipping This is a hazard for anybody with mobility/sight problems as well as those with buggies and is also a health hazard

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brookdene Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet
